subject: Re: [junit] What happened to popper?
msgSnippet: thaneanthem, I was the lead on the Popper project, and once Theories were included in JUnit, it had little further reason to exist. David Saff
messageBody:
thaneanthem,

I was the lead on the Popper project, and once Theories were included
in JUnit, it had little further reason to exist.

David Saff

On Fri, Oct 29, 2010 at 6:49 AM, thaneanthem <thaneanthem@...> wrote:
> The JUnit README (http://junit.sourceforge.net/README.html) directs readers to the Popper project for more information about Theories, but the Popper project appears to be no longer.  Fortunately, an archive of the referenced tutorial document is still available at http://www.tigris.org/ds/viewMessage.do?dsMessageId=2450079&dsForumId=446
>
> I was just curious if anyone knows what happened to the Popper project.  I have not found an explanation for its disappearance.
>
>
>
